compare this to To create and structure CLAUDE.md files for a large repository, use a multi-tiered approach that combines a global file at the root level and concise, focused files within key subdirectories or modules. This lets Claude Code load relevant documentation only where needed, keeping context precise and the AI’s guidance accurate for large, complex projects.​

Core Principles and Structure
Root-Level CLAUDE.md (Project Scope):

Place a CLAUDE.md in the repository root.

Document overall architecture, core coding guidelines, major dependencies, and entry points for the project.

Include setup instructions, common bash commands, naming conventions, CI/CD pipelines, and key contacts or contributor guidelines.

Link out to more detailed docs (architecture diagrams, setup guides) rather than embedding long text—summarize and reference path.​

Module and Subsystem CLAUDE.md (Scoped Knowledge):

Add CLAUDE.md files to large subdirectories or modules: e.g., frontend/CLAUDE.md, backend/CLAUDE.md, api/CLAUDE.md.

Document only what is specific to that module: internal architecture, APIs, utility scripts, module-specific testing, local conventions.

Emphasize links to external or supporting files (schemas, integration docs) rather than repeating global information.​

Hierarchical Loading and Merging:

Claude Code automatically loads CLAUDE.md files in the current directory, then up the folder hierarchy recursively, merging context from most specific to broadest.

This means updates at any level immediately affect agent behavior, and nested files don't override but supplement higher-level ones.​

Best Practices
Keep Files Concise: Avoid monolithic files; each CLAUDE.md should be lean and focused to optimize context window usage. Reference external docs for depth.​

Document Critical Paths: Use clear headers like “Architecture Map,” “Testing Guide,” “Common Workflows.” Document frequently used APIs, patterns, or troubleshooting steps.

Cross-link Key Resources: Point to important design docs, problem/solution guides, and configuration files. Use relative paths for portability.​

Modular Updates: Update module CLAUDE.md files when changing internals, while keeping the root CLAUDE.md for overarching changes.

Enable Team Coordination: Note who maintains each CLAUDE.md and encourage contributors to log changes and share solutions.

Bootstrap with /init: On new or legacy repos, run /init to auto-generate a baseline CLAUDE.md file, then edit for accuracy.​​

Example Structure
text
/CLAUDE.md
  # Overall project architecture
  # Coding standards
  # Common CLI commands
  # Project setup instructions
  # Key subsystem references
  # Links to major docs

/frontend/CLAUDE.md
  # Frontend architecture overview
  # UI style guides, theming
  # State management practices
  # Frontend test instructions
  # Links to component docs

/api/CLAUDE.md
  # API design and routing
  # Authentication/authorization notes
  # API test coverage guidelines
  # Links to OpenAPI specs

/shared-utils/CLAUDE.md
  # Shared utilities documentation
  # Helper function notes
  # Troubleshooting patterns
